briefdescription.para: Port types, either a local or remote port.
Error codes which can be returned by socket functions.
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

detaileddescription.para: Formatted printf-style output to the serial port.
Write a null-terminated string to the serial port.
Write a single character to the serial port.
Unified representation of either a directory start or file entry.
On-disk directory start entry.
On-disk file entry structure for non-directory entries.
One sector of the free space map, containing an array of 64-bit bitfields.
Padded variant of the description block to exactly fill one sector.
A single GPT partition entry.
The GPT (GUID Partition Table) header.
A disk partition table consisting of four MBR partition entries.
Structure for an IP packet.

Long filename entry, overlays a directory_entry_t. These entries repeat before a non-lfn entry, each holding up to 13 UCS-2 characters. Note that they are not stored in order, the 'order' attribute indicates which order they go in.
FAT32 BIOS parameter block (BPB), stored in the boot sector of the drive.
A directory entry, e.g. file, volume label, directory, long filename entry.
Root System Description Table (RSDT)
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.
This is always the first entry in a directory block.
Each directory block sector contains two of these (half-sector entries).
Blocks until transmitter is ready.

briefdescription.para: ACPI Root System Description Pointer (RSDP)

detaileddescription.para: On-disk description block containing global filesystem metadata.
A disk partition entry within the MBR.
Structure and bitfields for representing IP fragmentation. Used within an ip_packet_t.
FAT32 FSINFO structure.
There is actually more to an ethernet frame than this (see the STD documents!) but we don't have access to it from the software.
Definition of a DHCP packet.
Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Root System Description Table (RSDT)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: TCP handler called by the IP layer.

detaileddescription.para:
encap_packet
encapsulating IP packet
segment
TCP segment
len
length of TCP segment including header
TCP handler called by the IP layer.

briefdescription.para: Initialise TCP protocol, must happen after IP.

detaileddescription.para: Initialise TCP protocol, must happen after IP.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t target_addr, uint16_t target_port, uint16_t source_port, bool blocking)
memberdef.name: connect

briefdescription.para: Connect to a TCP port at a given IPv4 address.

parameterdescription.para: Our source port to use, or 0 to choose automatically
Set to true if this call is to block until the connection is established or errors

simplesect.para: Zero or positive file descriptor number on success, negative for error

briefdescription.para: Close a TCP connection.

simplesect.para: zero on success, error code on error

briefdescription.para: Send data to an open socket.

simplesect.para: int number of bytes written

memberdef.argsstring: (int socket, void *buffer, uint32_t maxlen, bool blocking, uint32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: recv

briefdescription.para: Receive data from an open socket. The data is buffered, and this function will fill the buffer when there is data in the buffer to read.

parameterdescription.para: maximum size of data to receive to buffer
true if this call should block until the buffer has data

simplesect.para: int number of bytes received

briefdescription.para: Check if a socket has data ready to be read.

detaileddescription.para: Non-blocking check for buffered data on the given socket. Does not consume any data or modify the recv buffer.

simplesect.para: true if there is data available to read, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the socket is connected.

simplesect.para: true if socket is connected, false if not. This will return false if connect() hasn't succeeded yet.

briefdescription.para: Return the error description associated with an error code.

simplesect.para: Invalid error codes return the constant "No error".
const char* description

briefdescription.para: Idle loop ran from timer ISR.

detaileddescription.para: Idle loop ran from timer ISR.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a new empty queue.

simplesect.para: queue_t* newly allocated queue, or NULL on failure

briefdescription.para: Push a tcp_conn_t into the queue.
Pop the oldest tcp_conn_t from the queue.

simplesect.para: tcp_conn_t* dequeued connection, or NULL if empty

briefdescription.para: Return true if queue is empty.

simplesect.para: true if empty, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Free all nodes in the queue and the queue itself.
Allocate a new file descriptor for a TCP connection.

simplesect.para: O(n) time
File descriptor number on success, or -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free a previously allocated TCP file descriptor.

simplesect.para: O(1) time

briefdescription.para: Find a TCP connection by its file descriptor.

simplesect.para: O(1) time
Pointer to the TCP connection if found, or NULL if not found.

memberdef.argsstring: (bool in, tcp_conn_t *conn, const ip_packet_t *encap_packet, const tcp_segment_t *segment, const tcp_options_t *options, size_t len, uint16_t our_checksum)
memberdef.name: tcp_dump_segment

briefdescription.para: Dump debug info for a TCP segment.
Create a listening TCP socket.

detaileddescription.para: Binds a TCP connection control block (TCB) to the given local address and port, and transitions it into the LISTEN state. A pending connection queue is created to hold halfopen connections until they are accepted.

parameterdescription.para: Local IPv4 address to bind to (network byte order).
Local TCP port to listen on (host byte order).
Maximum number of pending connections that may be queued.

simplesect.para: File descriptor for the listening socket on success, or a negative TCP_ERROR code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Accept an incoming connection on a listening socket.

detaileddescription.para: Removes one pending connection from the listening sockets queue and allocates a new file descriptor for it. The connection will be in the ESTABLISHED state upon return.

parameterdescription.para: File descriptor of a socket previously placed in the LISTEN state using tcp_listen().

simplesect.para: File descriptor for the accepted connection on success, or a negative TCP_ERROR code on failure.
